name: La Aldea de la Selva Lodge & Spa

reviews.title: Amazing Little Gem
reviews.text: I had originally booked my single night stay at a hotel on the Brazilian side of the border. After a deeper search of hotels, I found the Aldea de la Selva. Since I was flying in and out of Iguazu (FOZ) in Brazil, I was somewhat concerned that the transborder stay might be complicating. It was not. Perhaps an additional 15 minutes from airport to hotel and well worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You arrive at the hotel on a very "American" looking highway. There is a sharp turn off and all of a sudden it feels as though you are in the jungle, even though you know the turnpike is only metres away.
reviews.title: Amazing experience in comfortable surrounding...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is small and quiet. I was met by the only apparent staff person. He summoned someone to assist me with my luggage. He explained they did not have room numbers, but rather room names. Sure whatever. I was escorted to Orquideas. There are several buildings, generally with four rooms (units) in each. Sort of Melrose Place-esque. The rooms are very textured, with wooden floor, wooden walls, what appeared to be indigenously carved furniture and fixtures, yet peppered with very modern amenities, such as flat screen televisions, discreet and efficient air conditioners and very decent broadband wifi.
reviews.title: Amazing place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I had dinner at the hotel restaurant (aka transformed lobby). The menu was very interesting and as this was my first time to Argentina (I suppose I can make that claim) I was eager to try the infamous beef. The meal was very good, except there is a heavy hand with salt in this restaurant and I later found out - in the entire country. Also, I was somewhat with the winelist. Great selections, but everything was by the bottle. I wanted a s glass of white and a glass of red. Luckily there were a few half bottles. Unluckily, I had two and was subsequently off to bed in short order after dinner.
reviews.title: What a wonderful place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: My only gripe is that I wished to leave a gratuity and as with so many countries I've visited, they will not allow you to add it through your credit card transaction. I suppose it is my fault for not carrying currency with me.
reviews.title: Great jungle experience in eco-type lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel through booking for two nights, we then decided to add an other night before, so my argentine sister in law called to make a reservation. They gave us a confirmation number and everything was fine. I also emailed them weeks in advance to confirm with them that I can have a gluten free bread for breakfast (since it was included in our rates). I got an answer from the hotel confirming that everything would be ok. We arrived with my husband there and they didn't have our reservation for the first night. They were not even speaking english and didn't care at all. They put us in one room for the first night and had to change for the following two other nights. We were travelling for a long time before and moving all the time was something that I didn't want to do. The manager was the only one speaking english and was not there so often. They didn't offer us any compensations.
reviews.title: the service of this hotel is not good!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The night was Christmas eve, there was USD$60/70 dinner organized by the hotel. The food was the worst that we had in the entire trip in Argentina.
reviews.title: A haven that took a Hellish week to reach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next morning, I asked for my gluten free bread and they came back to me saying that they don't have any and didn't care. So, for the entire stay I didn't have breakfast at all since you can't even go to the store since you are so far away from everything. The last morning, I had some kids gluten free cereals which was so bad.
reviews.title: I enjoyed the stay, but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the end of the stay I asked to speak with the manager and the only discount he made was for USD$30 for breakfast.
reviews.title: Lovely Tropical Experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010
reviews.text: There was no hot water in the shower. The internet was only at the lobby. My sister who stayed there also had a leak everytime in the shower.
reviews.title: Great hotel, food very hit and miss!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Aldea Lodge for 2 nights. The resort style rain-forest lodge is well maintained and was a good choice for our Iguazu trip. Rooms are clean and spacious with all amentities one might need but not expect: Aircon, free WiFi, big brandnew LCD TV and even a Mini-Bar. However certain services malfunctioned during our short stay, e.g. the Telephone broke down and never returned to service. Best buy at Aldea is definitely the Jungle Fly, a rainforrest adventure on the grounds of the hotel. Your are climbing very tall trees to fly on rails between them, a very fun while safe adventure! The hotel organized also some tours for us, as we don't like being on tour buses so much we would strongly recommend to rent a car instead as visiting the falls can be easily done at your own pace!
reviews.title: Try the Jungle Fly at Aldea!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We booked this hotel through Orbitz and we paid $200 dlls per room for one night. It includes breakfast and full access to the pool. They have a bar by the pool, we had mojitos and caipirinhas, which were pretty good.
reviews.title: New and beautiful...right in the middle of the jungle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms are very spacious, equiped with AC and fans. Mosquito nets on all windows. Location is good, the taxi charged $80 pesos ($22 dlls) from the bus terminal to the hotel. We took a cab the next day to Iguazu Park and went straight to the airport.
reviews.title: Terrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We saw lightbugs, heard wild birds...it was a once in a lifetime experience.
reviews.title: Comfortable yet quirky option if you want to avoid big chain hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for dinner and it was amazing (local fish wraped in banana leaves). I strongly recommend this place. Front desk/restaurant have free WiFi
reviews.title: Perfect surroundings to appreciate Iguazu

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: So glad that I stayed at this lodge. Really beautiful surroundings, peaceful evenings. Very nice staff. Couldn't have been better.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is gorgeous. You walk in and feel transported to your own little piece of jungle paradise. That being said, I wish we would have been told a little more when we arrived. For instance, we were in Iguazu for two days. We arrived on a nice sunny late morning and decided to walk to town instead of going to the falls as we would have more time the following day. We even spoke with the front desk before making our plans. We woke up the next morning to pouring rain. It would have been nice to have been told that the forecast was for rain and to go to the falls on our first day. The staff also didnt really know things to do around town or have any recommendations for restaurants. We felt a little on our own. Also, no hot water for the first day.
reviews.title: Great hotel, but staff was not very knowledgable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like most hotels in Puerto Iguazu they serve as a hub for the falls. I selected this hotel as its set in the jungle and it didnt disappoint. So it rained....(alot) but that adds to the feel of staying there. The food was good and the pool area was perfect after a day of trekking around the falls. The majority of staff were super friendly and made they stay even more enjoyable....I would def recommend
reviews.title: Totally Tropical !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the La Aldea in March 2010, on our second trip to Argentina, this time we wanted to visit Iguazu Falls, we looked at various hotels and as we were only staying for two nights we wanted somewhere near the falls which was the main point of the trip.
reviews.title: Enjoyable but not quite what you expect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Interstingly we were advised not to stay at the Sheraton given its potential overpricing etc, but hindlsight makes us think again - however the Hotel itself was okay the rooms are cabins in a jungle style setting (as the Hotel name implies) the Pool area was very nice although the Pool Bar service was a bit hit and miss, the first nights dinner we were told on arrival was a BBQ - which being a Veggie did not suit me, they managed to offer me something else - but the BBQ food was not quite normal Argentinian standard, the second night we were moved into the room used for the Computer Access which had some additional tables as they were having an official event in the main room - this was again a dissapointment, however, the hotel did organise all our trips to the Falls which were fantastic and made up for any other dissapointment. The hotel however is a short taxi ride from Iquazu town which whilst small is very enjoyable - despite the tropical storm we had ......visit the cafe opposite the bank on the high street - the Empanada's are fantastic !
reviews.title: A lovely experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was great. I was really excited about having our own hammock, and fully enjoyed it when we arrived. I can't rave enough about the restaurant in the hotel - we spent a great deal of time in Argentina, and the steaks that we had in the two nights that we stayed at this hotel are in our top 5 meals during a 3 week vacation (very reasonably priced as well). My only qualm is that in the room information packet, there is no information about how to get to the falls. The staff was extremely helpful when we asked (both for the AR and BR sides), but a handout on which bus to take or the options on transport and entrance fees would be a nice addition. Obviously not a deal breaker. :)
reviews.title: An oasis near the falls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a series of brick built cabins in the jungle, it really gives an air of tranquility and peace. The service was excellent, despite what other reviewers say we found the level of spoken English amongst staff good. I do think if you are going to travel it wouldn't do any harm to learn some basic Spanish, you really do not need much to get by in a hotel!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The pool is perfect and surprisingly for such a small hotel there is full service including towels and a very attentive bar man.
reviews.title: A Tranquil Haven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We managed to get wifi in our cabin but was slow and much better in the lobby.
reviews.title: Your room built in the forest, not far from the Iguazu Falls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate two evening meals in the hotel and both were excellent as was the extensive wine list.
reviews.title: Great stay in the jungle just 100 meters away from main road!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Constructed within the jungle in an environmentally appropriate way, one always has the impression that this hotel is not fulfilling its potential. We arrived during a particularly cold and rainy spell. My husband was sick. Stil, it took 3 calls to get someone to repair the heater that would only put out cold air. The rooms are dark and dank, though perhaps that is the fate of a jungle hotel. The great lodge room is terrific, with wonderful indigenous art on the walls and throughout. The casualness of the environment is very restful. Dinner serves up local fish, for example a smoky tasting sibaru cooked in a banana leaf, as well as other good dishes. Service is attentive. This is not for the traveler who wants to be in the middle of the action, as the hotel is located outside of town and Parque Iguazu. I would go back there on another visit with the hope that some of the inattention to upkeep has improved.
reviews.title: This could be a great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a 4 nights stay after we read the good reviews on tripadvisor. Our frist impression was also quite positive: the location is a bit up from the main street, the whole place is surrounded by rainforest and the resort is built of little bungalows connected by wooden trails.
reviews.title: Rustic jungle feeling for a lot of money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But when entering the room, the good impression disappeared. Our room was dark, damp, had a funny smell and was not really clean. Also, there were huge cracks in the wood allowing all sorts of animals and insects in the room. Before going to bed, we always started a little hunt. We had dinner at the restaurant once where the food is average and service very slow. Breakfast is also not really outstanding.
reviews.title: Quite Good, But Could Be Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One nice feature is the pool area where you have a little bar, although is was not staffed all the time.
reviews.title: Dirty and damp but great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In general: overpiced for such a rustic experience
reviews.title: lushuous greenery, terrible food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk staff were very helpful with planning our trip to Iguazu Falls as well as dinner in town. The rooms are comfortable although a bit cool as it is set in the forest. The lodge is located between the falls and the town so we opted for taking cabs which suited us just fine.
reviews.title: Friendly staff and great experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although a few miles from Puerto Iguazu we fell completely in the jungle. The surroundings (selva) couldn’t be more interesting. The rooms are spacious but not very cosy. Breakfast good and the main building charming. When we arrive to the airport the transfer (pre-paid) wasn’t there. Well, they apologize and immediately reimbursed us.
reviews.title: Surprising!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed
reviews.title: A true juvel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we travel, my wife and I have different preferences. I like nature, wildlife and especially birding, whereas my wife prefer wellness, basking in the sun and swimming. When we travel we divide our vacation in two - one part nature, wildlife and one part sun & sea. I chose La Aldea de la Selva Lodge for my part, because it is situated in the rain forest and has lots of birds and other wildlife very close. In addition there is both swimmingpool and spa. Out of the three places we visited in Argentina, La Aldea de la Selva Lodge was the favorite hotel of my wife - and me too of course. The rooms are large, clean and have good facilities. There is a cabin with free internet. The restaurant serves very delicious food and the staff provides an excellent service. The place is very quiet except for the sounds of the rain forest, so sleeping and relaxing is absolutely not a problem. There are only few mosquitoes and no dangerous animals at all. La Aldea de la Selva Lodge is a short walk from the highway, so it is easy to catch the bus to the Iguazu Waterfalls or downtown. We enjoyed our stay very much. La Aldea de la Selva Lodge is absolutely a hotel we both would like to come back to.
reviews.title: A great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010
reviews.text: Should I ever have a garden, it should be like the garden of La Aldea de la Selva Lodge. No lawn moving and no watering.
reviews.title: Physically nice looking but problem with water which ruined it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: La Aldea Selva was comfortable and a very enjoyable retreat in the jungle. We had a suite, which was spacious although not best laid-out to utilise it. It was a real treat to be in a log cabin in the forest, with a large balcony overlooking it, with a hammock and swing chair. We often just listened to all the life going on out there. However, because the Falls are the real reason to be in Iguazu, we spent fairly little time there.
reviews.title: Quirky, Comfortable Jungle-Lite Lodging

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff was fine, friendly and helpful, but not exceptionally so. Breakfast was no more than adequate - no hot choices, just breads, pastries, cold meats, etc. - and the restaurant similarly only fair. Wireless internet is free and worked OK in our room, albeit very slowly.
reviews.title: Excellent service and a wonderful jungle atmosphere without being too raw.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: For us, this was a better choice than the Sheraton, which, although right next to the Falls, is just so ugly and unsympathetic to the environment we couldn't bring ourselves to stay there. La Aldea was a charming, peaceful and low key alternative and we were very glad of our choice. Some may find its location inconvenient: you will need a car or taxi or use the local buses (cheap and reliable) to get around, which gets inconvenient and time-consuming after a while.
reviews.title: Wonderful accomodations in the jungle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We met my sister and her husband here, who had been on a missionary assignment for 10 months in Paraguay. We hoped it would be a nice getaway for them, as well as a comfortable place to visit and catch up. We were not dissapointed.
reviews.title: Hotel comfort in selva surroundings.

likes.liked: — It is comfortable yet still in the selva

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The staff is eager to please. The rooms are rustic, not luxurious at all, but a perfect balance for the setting. The beds are comfortable, the bathrooms adequate. . .there is a private balcony for each room that overlooks the jungle setting. Wifi is supposedly free in the room, but the signal is not strong enough. However, there is a business center nearby that you can go to, that has good signal.
reviews.title: In the Rain Forest

aka: La Aldea De La Selva Lodge And Spa
description: No matter what your interests are, La Aldea de la Selva Lodge offers the lifestyle you naturally prefer. Relaxing, hiking down the rain forest trails, being in contact with the wildlife, daring to the adventure of rappelling in the canopies or simply discovering new aspects of cooking hand in hand with our chef. Staying at La Aldea de la Selva Lodge means getting embarked on a memorable voyage through the local culture.
